Henning Volz BOGLARKA BARTHA(CS Luxembourg),DMITRIJ SENKO(Eurex Clearing AG),FABRICE TOMENKO(CI Luxembourg),FRANK GAST(Eurex Repo GmbH),GREGOR POTTMEYER(Deutsche Börse AG),JEAN-MARC DI CATO(CBL Luxembourg),MARCO CALIGARIS(LUXCSD),PHILIP BROWN(Clearstream Holding AG),SONIA DRIBEK-PFLEGE(Clearstream Fund CentreSA),UDO HENKELMANN(Clearstream Europe AG),WOLFGANG EHOLZER(Eurex Frankfurt AG) Obsolete - Inadequate Governance Structure Other framework 3,47,3,9,CSDR L2 153/2023,CSDR L2 2017/392
2024-063_F01 2024 2024-063 Technology Governance (DBAG, ECAG, CBF, CBL, CFCL) 2024-063_F01-A06 Multi-Recommendation Open S3 Incomplete ICT Risk Management framework & lack of harmonisation between DBG’s first and second LoD As identified in the CIO Strategy 2021 and the CIO division reorganisation, which was effective from Q3 2022, the closed 2022-051_F01 self-identified issue (SII)  planned to establish a consistent Group-wide IT Governance framework and function, including clear delineation of Deutsche Börse Group’s (DBG) first (1LoD) and second (2LoD) lines of defence roles and responsibilities, by January 2024.

Internal Audit’s (IA) review of this SII noted that, although progress was made since 2022, the planned actions for IT Governance framework were incomplete. Due to responsibility shifts triggered by the January 2024 reorganisation and a new written rule structure, formalisation of the ICT Risk Management framework was prolonged. Thus, in the past years, a stable business-as-usual and sustainable state of Deutsche Börse Group’s (DBG) ICT Risk Management Framework and Governance had not been achieved. In detail:

1) ICT Risk Management Framework completeness
§ At the end of 2023, the development of IT Written Rules (ITWR) by 1LoD IT Governance, Risk and Transformation (IRT) was ongoing. However, the January 2024 reorganisation formally shifted responsibility to 2LoD ICT Risk Framework (KJU) for developing 14 Information Communication and Technology (ICT) Guidelines (erstwhile called “standards”) aligned with the Digital Operational Resilience Act (DORA) risk management framework by December 2024.
§ 1LoD IRT plans to subsequently formalise the ITWR operational documentation (“procedures”) and fulfil control requirements to verify compliance. This is planned as a multi-year journey.
§ Although SII 2022-051_F01 anticipated 1LoD IRT’s alignment of the IT Governance framework with all affected Shared and Product ITs, this was not ensured since the alignment was on a best effort basis.

Moreover, the priority-oriented DORA-readiness implementation plan scheduled completion of Design (DE) and Operating Effectiveness (OE) for 7 out of 18 areas by January 2025. For the remaining eleven areas, prioritisation efforts were channeled towards achieving maturity, with DE completed by that date, and continuous improvements towards OE scheduled to last until end of 2025. The DBG Legal Entities’ DORA progress was tracked and monitored by appropriate oversight mechanisms, e.g. Steering Committees, Board presentations.

2) DBG 1LoD and 2LoD responsibilities
By end of 2023, DBG’s 2LoD lacked an IT framework and performed no IS Compliance control activities. Following the 1 January 2024 reorganisation, 2LoD defined a target “IT Compliance & ICT – Operating Model” (TOM) to include the missing activities. By June 2024, it was only aligned with DBAG, ongoing with other Legal Entities (LEs).

IA identified the following 1LoD and 2LoD roles and responsibilities gaps regarding ICT activities, as well as alignment between 2LoD functions of affected LEs:
§ After the responsibilities split/handover in Q1 2024 between 1LoD IRT and 2LoD CICTRO/CISO (ICT), co-ordination role for ICS (Internal Control Systems) in DBAG IT has been assigned to 2LoD CICTRO/CISO, as well as control monitoring and quality assurance activities. Since providing guidance on how controls are defined and executed would impact 2LoD CICTRO independence to oversee 1LoD activities, 2LoD CICTRO was aiming at coordination without providing guidance. However, a transfer of responsibility to IRT on providing guidance to 1LoD was also not initiated.
§ Pending LE CISOs (2LoD) decision to include performing oversight and controlling of IT/ICT risks by either extending their responsibilities or to assign it within other 2LoD. Agreement with DBAG CICTRO/CISO over the potential outsourcing services to follow.
§ Pending LE’s Compliance Officers’ decision on aligning with DBAG (2LoD) Group Compliance Strategy (SCG) regarding Group-wide IT Compliance setup and responsibilities, focusing on design-type controls and reviews of ICT or IS regulations. This was due to ongoing update of the new Group Compliance SDS (Service Definition Statement) and the IT Compliance services to be provided to LEs. Therefore, the agreement on the services between DBAG’s SCG and LEs, e.g. CBL (incl. CS/CI/LuxCSD) and CFCL was delayed. (For details, refer section 6.2)

3) IS Assurance plan completeness and Security Risk Management
§ Incomplete 2LoD oversight in the past years – DBAG and impacted LEs (dependent on DBAG’s coverage) IS assurance plans execution was partial due to approach changes or personnel unavailability. (For details, refer section 6.3).
§ The Ecosystem Security Risk Management (ESRM), managed via the Prevalent (AID2040) tool, did not have a sufficient solution to record affected LEs’ risk acceptance approvals. The current provision is to inform the “using” LEs about the risk/status and only provide the “owning” LE’s confirmation/acceptance evidence. This deficiency’s remediation is being tracked via IA’s open “Audit BaFin IT Outsourcing 2022” validation report Note #N10.

The above-mentioned weaknesses were caused by an inadequate governance structure. It was also impacted by personnel / organisational structure changes throughout 2024.

German and Luxembourg regulation emphasises the need for robust governance arrangements and adequate internal control mechanisms. Processes, as well as the related tasks, competencies, responsibilities, controls and reporting channels should be clearly defined and coordinated. Regulation also requires that activities are conducted based on organisational guidelines.

To note, the remediation measures for above-mentioned activities are subject to multiple team coordination and availability, including the appointment of the CICTRO/CISO personnel. Thus, submission to IA of the Corrective Action Plan (CAP) is planned by 24 January 2025.
=============

The identified weaknesses and some ongoing topics’ planned mitigating measures are separately detailed in this report’s section 6 “Annex - Audit Observations”.
6. Annex - Audit Observations
Referencing the F01 finding raised above, the details included herewith are supporting some of its identified weaknesses and the ongoing topics’ planned mitigating measures:

6.1 Incomplete requirements of ICT Governance Framework
Internal Audit noted that 2LoD ICT Risk Framework (KJU) development of the encompassing 14 ICT Guidelines aligned with the DORA risk management framework was scheduled for completion by December 2024 and progress tracked in the IT Amelioration (AMELI) program. Besides, MCRC (Minimum Control Requirements Checklist) IT control requirements are/will be gradually moved into updated or newly developed Guidelines.

-------
6.2 Alignment on arrangement of new IT Compliance setup within DBG’s legal entities
In 2023, the first IT Compliance control plan was generated on a risk-based approach and controls were executed accordingly. In 2024, a control plan was developed to execute controls on critical topics and the first DBAG IT Compliance Risk Assessment (CRAF “Compliance Risk Assessment Framework” Methodology) finalised.

At the end of Q3 2024, the following Group-wide activities were planned by DBAG Group Compliance Strategy (SCG) as outlined below:
§ Planned activities for 2025:
- At DBAG level, a revised control planning methodology was in development, and in alignment with ExR, CBF (incl. CH), CBL (incl. CS/CI/LuxCSD) and ECAG (incl. EFAG), reflecting a 4-year cycle (2023-26) to complete controls for all ICS L1 processes.
- New TOM “IT Compliance and ICT Risk – Operating Model” reflecting the new DORA requirements (Project supported by Protiviti consultant); rollout was scheduled through 2024 and will be operational beginning of 2025.
- Revise the CRAF 2.0 reflecting the DORA requirements as well.
- Enhance regulatory screening process going forward for all IT and IS related regulations.
§ For 2025, the status regarding service agreements are as follows:
- ExR, CBF (incl. CH): IT Compliance is fully outsourced to DBAG.
- ECAG (incl. EFAG): Framework and Risk Assessment are outsourced to DBAG since 1 September 2024; and controls will be jointly executed where deemed feasible. IT and IS Compliance topics were covered in its Annual Compliance Control Plans.
- CBL (incl. CS/CI/LuxCSD) is currently in clarification. An outsourcing will take place, yet its frame is still under discussion. Implementation expected by 2025. 
- CFCL: although the outsourcing setup discussion is ongoing, no decision has been finalised as the agreement over the services that DBAG Compliance will be offering is in draft. The effective date is targeted for the end of Q1 2025.
-------
6.3 Second LoD ICT Risk Assurance – methodology and planned activities
IA noted that, as a result of partially executed IS assurance plans in the past years, the “IS Assurance Assessment Deliverables” key performance indicators (KPI) across DBG were not achieved.

In Q3 2024, following an updated “IS Assurance Handbook and Methodology” and formal approval by LE CISO’s in September 2024, two assessments planned for H2 2024 as pilots to the new methodology were initiated by 2LoD ICT Risk Assurance (KIU) and ongoing at the time of audit.

As per revised methodology, effective January 2025,
§ the “non-conformity” from H2 2024 pilot and onward assessments will be tracked via AMIT tool (Component ID: 1847878, CID5168), and
§ for output from previous assessments - 2023 and H1 2024 – and “improvement opportunities” from new assessments an internal Excel-based tracker is adopted for monitoring and tracking purposes.		 Control Env. + Des. Eff + Op. Eff. Internal Audit recommends that Information Security (ISU) – legal entity (LE) CISOs for CBF/CH/CBL/CI/CS/LuxCSD and CFCL i.e. Post Trade ICT Risk 2LoD:
§ design a DORA-compliant operating model to be formally approved by Management with ensuring adequate budget and staffing levels.
§ operationalise the model to ensure oversight and controlling of ICT risks.
§ finalise potential additional service agreements between the LEs by end of Q2 2025.

Also, in support and collaboration with Chief ICT Risk Officer/CISO (ICT), update the service agreement between Post Trade ICT Risk 2LoD and DBAG with relevant ICT elements by end of Q2 2025.		 05.12.2024 15.12.2025 15.12.2025 0 CBL Luxembourg,CI Luxembourg,CS Luxembourg,Clearstream Europe AG,Clearstream Fund CentreSA,Clearstream Holding AG,Deutsche Börse AG,Eurex Clearing AG,Eurex Frankfurt AG,Eurex Repo GmbH,Group IT Audit,LUXCSD CBL Luxembourg,CI Luxembourg,CS Luxembourg,Clearstream Europe AG,Clearstream Fund CentreSA,Clearstream Holding AG,Deutsche Börse AG,Eurex Clearing AG,Eurex Frankfurt AG,Eurex Repo GmbH,Group IT Audit,LUXCSD CBL Luxembourg Petr Strnad, Christian Gorke, Néjib Zaouali Aleksandra Galaganova Yezad Wadia JENS SCHULTE(Deutsche Börse AG) JEAN-MARC DI CATO Post Trading (Div) Clearstream Securities Services (A) Samuel Riley Post-Trade - ICT Risk Control Functi (S) Information Security (ISU) agrees with the finding and recommendation, and will implement the recommendation. Incomplete ICT Risk Management framework results in an inadequately established control environment. The delineation between DBG’s 1LoD and 2LoD did not effectively allow performing all responsibilities provided in the Information Security Policy, and effective assurance of 1LoD’s compliance with the framework.
